title: Coping With the Long Shadow of China
text:
“May you live in interesting times” has long been thought to be a traditional Chinese curse. But like many popular notions about China, it looms so large that it obscures the truth. The origin of the phrase, though certainly fitting for today’s times, is largely apocryphal.

China itself has an outsize stake in today’s political, economic, and investing discourse. Its influence, as Reshma Kapadia notes in this Fund Quarterly’s cover story, is overpowering—and its long shadow is obscuring what’s going on in the rest of the...
description: Investors need to look beyond China for opportunities in other emerging markets. Plus: how investors can find a haven as volatility increases.
